definition: to cure by drying over a fire (tea, meat etc)/to bake
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
to dry over a fire/to bake

sentences.english: Then they bake it in an extremely hot oven.
sentences.chinese: 最后将它置入高温炉里烘焙。

sentences.english: Personally, I do not bake any PC in my kitchen oven.
sentences.chinese: 个人来说，我从来不会用我的厨房炉子来烘焙软陶。

sentences.english: Peaches are widely eaten fresh and are baked in desserts.
sentences.chinese: 桃被广泛地使用于鲜食和甜点烘焙中。

sentences.english: After that, you can roll it out and get it ready to top and bake.
sentences.chinese: 然后你就可以擀面，往上加料和烘焙了。

sentences.english: Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and crisp. Transfer them onto a wire rack to cool.
sentences.chinese: 烘焙20分钟或是直到金黄酥松，放到架上晾凉。

sentences.english: The best indicators for the new coffee roaster learning the process is sound.
sentences.chinese: 对于初学烘焙者来说，最好的学习标准是声音。
新创高温烘焙手艺烤粉腮红。

sentences.english: While the cupcakes are cooking, make the frosting.
sentences.chinese: 当蛋糕还在烤箱中烘焙时，制作糖霜。

sentences.english: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm.
sentences.chinese: 在预热好的烤箱里烘焙8到10分钟，直到姜饼定型。

sentences.english: You are a finalist in the Pillsbury Bake-Off.
sentences.chinese: 你入选皮尔斯博瑞烘焙大赛决赛了。

sentences.english: Cover with a sheet of non-stick baking parchment.
sentences.chinese: 用一张不粘烘焙仿羊皮纸包上。

sentences.english: There was an enormous ham for baking, and canned vegetables and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个巨大的供烘焙的火腿，罐装蔬菜和西红柿。
面色师布莱克烘焙黑面包。

sentences.english: A sweet quick bread baked in a cup-shaped pan.
sentences.chinese: 在杯形盘里烘焙的速食甜面包。

sentences.english: It only creates a strong bond when baked.
sentences.chinese: 它只在烘焙后才会产生强粘结力。

sentences.english: Darker roasts also yield more caffeine.
sentences.chinese: 烘焙的颜色越深也会含有更高的咖啡因。

definition: cookie (loanword via Cantonese 曲奇 kuk1 kei4)
West Point, US military academy in New York
macaron, French pastry with a soft filling sandwiched between the meringue-based cookie shells (loanword)
